original_solution_mapping.L1: 20% of her 40 students will bring their own life vest so .20*40 = <<.20*40=8>>8 students will bring their life vests
original_solution_mapping.L2: Alice has 20 life vests and 8 students will bring there's so that's 20+8 = <<20+8=28>>28 life vests
original_solution_mapping.L3: There are 40 students and 10 instructors total so that's 40+10 = <<40+10=50>>50 people in the class
original_solution_mapping.L4: If there are 28 life vests and she has 50 people then she needs to find 50-28 = 22 more life vests

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5588.
    Returns: the number of additional life vests Alice needs.
    """
    # L1
    num_students = 40 # 40 students
    percent_students_bringing_vests = 0.20 # 20% of her students are bringing life vests
    students_bringing_vests = percent_students_bringing_vests * num_students

    # L2
    vests_on_hand = 20 # 20 life vests on hand
    total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs = vests_on_hand + students_bringing_vests

    # L3
    num_instructors = 10 # 10 instructors
    total_class_members = num_students + num_instructors

    # L4
    additional_vests_needed = total_class_members - total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs

    # FA
    answer = additional_vests_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 20% of her {num_students} students will bring their own life vest so {percent_students_bringing_vests}*{num_students} = <<{percent_students_bringing_vests}*{num_students}={students_bringing_vests}>>{students_bringing_vests} students will bring their life vests

Alice has {vests_on_hand} life vests and {students_bringing_vests} students will bring there's so that's {vests_on_hand}+{students_bringing_vests} = <<{vests_on_hand}+{students_bringing_vests}={total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs}>>{total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs} life vests

There are {num_students} students and {num_instructors} instructors total so that's {num_students}+{num_instructors} = <<{num_students}+{num_instructors}={total_class_members}>>{total_class_members} people in the class

If there are {total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs} life vests and she has {total_class_members} people then she needs to find {total_class_members}-{total_vests_after_students_bring_theirs} = {additional_vests_needed} more life vests

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 20% of her 40 students will bring their own life vest so 0.2*40 = <<0.2*40=8>>8 students will bring their life vests
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Alice has 20 life vests and 8 students will bring there's so that's 20+8 = <<20+8=28>>28 life vests
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: There are 40 students and 40 instructors total so that's 40+40 = <<40+40=80>>80 people in the class
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: If there are 28 life vests and she has 80 people then she needs to find 80-28 = 52 more life vests

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'num_students' (40) was used instead of 'num_instructors' (10).
